vulnerabilities.title: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `apt` package._

It was found that apt-key in apt, all versions, do not correctly validate gpg keys with the master keyring, leading to a potential man-in-the-middle attack.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `apt`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2011-3374)
- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=642480)
- [MISC](https://people.canonical.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/2011/CVE-2011-3374.html)
- [MISC](https://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2011/Sep/221)
- [MISC](https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-LINUX-APT-116518)
- [MISC](https://ubuntu.com/security/CVE-2011-3374)
- [RedHat CVE Database](https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2011-3374)
vulnerabilities.name: apt/libapt-pkg6.0

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0008/)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26574)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/git/gitweb.cgi?p=binutils-gdb.git;h=8642dafaef21aa6747cec01df1977e9c52eb4679)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-24)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1913743)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20284)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210521-0010/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1937784)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26931)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3487)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/3Z3KSJY3CLAAFFT7FNFCJOMDITPQGN56/)

- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3549)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1960717)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

stab_xcoff_builtin_type in stabs.c in GNU Binutils through 2.37 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by an out-of-bounds write. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2018-12699.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GCC v12.0 was discovered to contain an uncontrolled recursion via the component libiberty/rust-demangle.c. This vulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) by consuming excessive CPU and memory resources.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-46195)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=103841)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

Heap/stack buffer overflow in the dlang_lname function in d-demangle.c in libiberty allows attackers to potentially cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted mangled symbol.

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

remember_Ktype in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, allows attackers to trigger excessive memory consumption (aka OOM). This can occur during execution of cxxfilt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-12934)
- [MISC](https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/binutils/+bug/1763101)

- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=23059)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4336-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-12934)
- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4326-1/)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-9996)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=85304)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/103733)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-9996)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-13716)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22009)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-13716)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20623)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24049)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00072.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-11/msg00008.html)

- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4336-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20623)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20712)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20712)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=88629)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24043)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106563)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20712)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20673)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24039)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106454)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20673)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010204)

- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References

- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4336-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-18483)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20284)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210521-0010/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1937784)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26931)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3487)
- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/3Z3KSJY3CLAAFFT7FNFCJOMDITPQGN56/)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3530)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3549)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1960717)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

stab_xcoff_builtin_type in stabs.c in GNU Binutils through 2.37 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by an out-of-bounds write. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2018-12699.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-45078)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GCC v12.0 was discovered to contain an uncontrolled recursion via the component libiberty/rust-demangle.c. This vulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) by consuming excessive CPU and memory resources.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-46195)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=103841)

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils before 2.40, there is a heap-buffer-overflow in the error function bfd_getl32 when called from the strip_main function in strip-new via a crafted file.

Heap/stack buffer overflow in the dlang_lname function in d-demangle.c in libiberty allows attackers to potentially cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted mangled symbol.

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

remember_Ktype in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, allows attackers to trigger excessive memory consumption (aka OOM). This can occur during execution of cxxfilt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-9996)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=85304)

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-9996)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-13716)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22009)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20712)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20712)

- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24043)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106563)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20712)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20673)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24039)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106454)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20673)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010204)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=23765)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18483)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=87602)

- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-11/msg00008.html)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/105689)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4326-1/)
- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4336-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-18483)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0008/)

- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-24)

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)

- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GCC v12.0 was discovered to contain an uncontrolled recursion via the component libiberty/rust-demangle.c. This vulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) by consuming excessive CPU and memory resources.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-46195)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=103841)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils before 2.40, there is a heap-buffer-overflow in the error function bfd_getl32 when called from the strip_main function in strip-new via a crafted file.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

Heap/stack buffer overflow in the dlang_lname function in d-demangle.c in libiberty allows attackers to potentially cause a denial of service (segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted mangled symbol.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

remember_Ktype in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, allows attackers to trigger excessive memory consumption (aka OOM). This can occur during execution of cxxfilt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-12934)

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-9996)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=85304)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/103733)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-9996)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-common

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-13716)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22009)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-13716)

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20673)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0008/)

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)

- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-9996)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=85304)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/103733)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-9996)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-13716)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22009)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-13716)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20623)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24049)

- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4336-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20623)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20712)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20712)

- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24043)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106563)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20712)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20673)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24039)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106454)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20673)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/libbinutils

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)

- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18483)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1913743)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References

- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1960717)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

stab_xcoff_builtin_type in stabs.c in GNU Binutils through 2.37 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by an out-of-bounds write. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2018-12699.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010204)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=23765)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18483)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0008/)

- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-24)

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation

## Remediation

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3549)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1960717)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

stab_xcoff_builtin_type in stabs.c in GNU Binutils through 2.37 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by an out-of-bounds write. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2018-12699.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References

- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

remember_Ktype in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, allows attackers to trigger excessive memory consumption (aka OOM). This can occur during execution of cxxfilt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Uncontrolled Recursion
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30. Stack Exhaustion occurs in the C++ demangling functions provided by libiberty, and there are recursive stack frames: demangle_template_value_parm, demangle_integral_value, and demangle_expression.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-9996)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=85304)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/103733)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-9996)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-13716)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22009)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1913743)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.
## Remediation

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The C++ symbol demangler routine in cplus-dem.c in libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.29, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation and application crash) via a crafted file, as demonstrated by a call from the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd).
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-13716)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=22009)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-13716)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu

vulnerabilities.title: Use After Free
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

In GNU Binutils 2.31.1, there is a use-after-free in the error function in elfcomm.c when called from the process_archive function in readelf.c via a crafted ELF file.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20623)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24049)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-10/msg00072.html)
- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-11/msg00008.html)

- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4336-1/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20623)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A heap-based buffer over-read exists in the function d_expression_1 in cp-demangle.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1. A crafted input can cause segmentation faults, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K38336243)
- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20712)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20712)

- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24043)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106563)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20712)
vulnerabilities.name: binutils/binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The demangle_template function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31.1, contains an integer overflow vulnerability (for "Create an array for saving the template argument values") that can trigger a heap-based buffer overflow, as demonstrated by nm.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20673)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24039)
- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106454)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

GNU binutils gold gold v1.11-v1.16 (GNU binutils v2.21-v2.31.1) is affected by: Improper Input Validation, Signed/Unsigned Comparison, Out-of-bounds Read. The impact is: Denial of service. The component is: gold/fileread.cc:497, elfcpp/elfcpp_file.h:644. The attack vector is: An ELF file with an invalid e_shoff header field must be opened.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K05032915?utm_source=f5support&utm_medium=RSS)
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-1010204)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=23765)
- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0001/)
- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-1010204)

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18483)

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Read
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.35.1. A heap-based buffer over-read can occur in bfd_getl_signed_32 in libbfd.c because sh_entsize is not validated in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35448)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210129-0008/)

- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202107-24)

vulnerabilities.title: Race Condition
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There is an open race window when writing output in the following utilities in GNU binutils version 2.35 and earlier:ar, objcopy, strip, ranlib. When these utilities are run as a privileged user (presumably as part of a script updating binaries across different users), an unprivileged user can trick these utilities into getting ownership of arbitrary files through a symlink.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20197)
- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210528-0009/)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1913743)
- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26945)
- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202208-30)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was found in GNU Binutils 2.35.1, where there is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_elf_slurp_secondary_reloc_section in elf.c due to the number of symbols not calculated correctly. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

There's a flaw in the BFD library of binutils in versions before 2.36. An attacker who supplies a crafted file to an application linked with BFD, and using the DWARF functionality, could cause an impact to system availability by way of excessive memory consumption.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References

vulnerabilities.description:

**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

A flaw was discovered in GNU libiberty within demangle_path() in rust-demangle.c, as distributed in GNU Binutils version 2.36. A crafted symbol can cause stack memory to be exhausted leading to a crash.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

vulnerabilities.title: Out-of-bounds Write
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

An out of bounds flaw was found in GNU binutils objdump utility version 2.36. An attacker could use this flaw and pass a large section to avr_elf32_load_records_from_section() probably resulting in a crash or in some cases memory corruption. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to integrity as well as system availability.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-3549)
- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1960717)

vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

stab_xcoff_builtin_type in stabs.c in GNU Binutils through 2.37 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact, as demonstrated by an out-of-bounds write. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2018-12699.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.

GCC v12.0 was discovered to contain an uncontrolled recursion via the component libiberty/rust-demangle.c. This vulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service (DoS) by consuming excessive CPU and memory resources.

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow or Wraparound
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `binutils` package._

The get_count function in cplus-dem.c in GNU libiberty, as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.31, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (malloc called with the result of an integer-overflowing calculation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted string, as demonstrated by c++filt.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `binutils`.
## References
- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-18483)
- [MISC](https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=87602)

vulnerabilities.title: Improper Input Validation
vulnerabilities.description:
## NVD Description
**_Note:_** _Versions mentioned in the description apply to the upstream `coreutils` package._

chroot in GNU coreutils, when used with --userspec, allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.
## Remediation
There is no fixed version for `Debian:11` `coreutils`.
